column1: 01:50|She had to get out of this goddam camper. It might be the biggest
column3: but right now it felt the size of a coffin. She made her way to the door
column4: holding onto things to keep her balance. She glanced at the clock on the dashboard before she went out. Ten to two. Everything had happened in just twenty minutes. Incredible.|Doctor Sleep|Stephen King

column2: she thought: every spinster legal secretary
column4: and orthodontist had a cat or two—and she could not tolerate (not even as a lark
column5: not even for a moment at ten minutes before two AM)
